New Posted Date Posted 17 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Job description

  • Financial Analyst**:
  • Type**: Full time
  • Location**: Geelong
  • Apply by**: Sunday 16 September 2018
    • We are looking for an experienced and forward-thinking Financial Analyst to join our Economic Regulation and Reporting team.
    **
    About us**:
    Barwon Water is Victoria's largest regional urban water corporation, with more than 110 years experience in delivering world-class water, sewerage and recycled water services to our customers and community. More than just taps and toilets, we’re a pivotal player in the region’s ongoing social, economic and environmental prosperity.
    We care about where we live and work, and we’re always looking for like-minded people to join our team.
    • About the role**:
    You’ll work collaboratively with the team to provide regulatory, pricing, economic and financial analysis, along with commercial evaluation, performance reporting and forecasting services.
    **
    About you**:
    You’re a problem solver; highly analytical with a commercial mindset.
    Self-motivated with strong organisational skills, you work across multiple projects coordinating a range of disciplines.
    You have excellent communication skills and you build strong relationships with partners and people.
    **
    What we’re looking for**:
    • A degree or higher in commerce, including expertise in finance or economics.
    • Experience in a commercial, water or other regulated industry is preferred.
    • Experience in undertaking financial, commercial and statistical analysis.
    • Experience reviewing, preparing and communicating financial model results.
    • Experience working with senior management and other key stakeholders.
    • Why join us?**:
    We value your professional growth. We embrace diversity. We value fairness and equal opportunity. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to apply.
    We’re flexible and know the importance of work/life balance. If you’re a parent or caregiver, studying or have other needs, we can support you with flexible work hours and leave options.

    Some Of Our Exciting Opportunities And Benefits Include
    • rewarding personal development
    • an award-winning health, mental health, and wellbeing program
    • flexible leave and ‘purchased leave’ arrangements
    • access to pro-rata long service leave, including carry-over arrangements from the Victorian public sector.
    • access to our award-winning ‘Ryrie HQ’ and some of the most beautiful natural environments in Victoria.
    • best-practice innovation and employee recognition programs
    • height-adjustable sit/stand desks
    • free annual flu vaccinations
    • 24-hour employee assistance program
    • a social club geared towards you and your family
    • an industry superannuation fund
    • and much more.
    • Get in touch**:
    Does this opportunity sound like it might be a good fit for you?
    For enquiries or to find out more, call Denis Musaefendic, Senior Economist, on (03) 5226 2582 during business hours.
    For a copy of the position description, please email recruitment@barwonwater.vic.gov.au.
    Page last updated Friday 31 August 2018

Retail Goods Receiving / Warehouse - Geelong
Geelong VIC, Australia
  • Permanent role with an exceptional work environment
  • Ongoing training and upskilling
  • Australia's leading trade and industrial tool retailer

About The Role

Total Tools Geelong searching for multiple experienced goods receiving / warehousing people to join our team and assist our ever growing store network.

You will need outstanding organisational skills with a high focus on accuracy, and ideally have previous experience using an inventory system.

Your communication skills, thirst for product knowledge and attention to detail will enable you to perform exceptionally in this role. Previous goods receiving experience and a current forklift license is essential.

We will provide you with the training and knowledge to be the best you can be.

Required Skills And Experience
  • General product knowledge (industrial tool industry) to be able to identify individual items
  • Previous experience in stock control or inventory management
  • Strong customer service focus
  • A team player who is self-motivated
  • Forklift and drivers licenses are required
  • Experience using Pronto is preferred, but not essential.

What we are offering?
  • A competitive rate of pay
  • A friendly and welcoming team
  • Training and coaching
  • Values driven and supportive environment

Our Location

We are located at 252 Thompson Road North Geelong, 3215, Victoria

Who We Are

Total Tools is over 25 years old and has a strong support team which is a large part of our success. The company has over 70 franchised outlets & employs hundreds of people nationally. As a company we are considered the premier supplier of tools to trade & industry in Australia.

"The World's Greatest Service Organisation!"

We are currently recruiting for experienced and motivated Customer Service Supervisors to join our team working within an education industry on a full-time basis. The position will be covering the North Eastern Region. You will utilise your current supervisory and management skills, delivering service excellence to all external and internal stakeholders.

The Position
  • Manage, coach, mentor and lead a team of Cleaners

Job description

BlueCross and Sapphire Care, two of Victoria's most highly regarded Aged Care providers, have recently merged.
We have a reputation as Victoria's leading residential aged care providers and are known for outstanding premium care at our purpose built and high quality residences across Melbourne and Phillip Island.
Our STARfish principles and "Spirit" Values (Service, Performance, Integrity, Respect, Innovation and Teamwork) are key to who we are and reflect our culture and traditions. We pride ourselves in leading edge technology and innovations as well as a fun and fulfilling workplace for all our staff.
We pride ourselves in leading edge technology and innovations as well as a fun and fulfilling workplace for all our staff.
We are currently seeking a passionate and experienced Services Manager to work at our Ruckers Hill Facility in Northcote.
As a Services Manager at Sapphire Care your responsibilities will include but not be limited to;
  • Working with Client Services on residential contracts, admissions, referrals, tours,
  • Room preparation and entry of records on Aged Care online claiming (Medicare)
  • Working cooperatively with the Residential Manager and Clinical Manager to ensure a high standard of care and lifestyle to residents as well as contributing to the efficient and effective management of human, material and fiscal resource management
  • Managing the external service contracts: catering, cleaning, maintenance and other
  • External providers to ensure high standard of compliance and service delivery.
  • Assisting with roster management/leave replacement, ensuring minimal agency usage
  • Overseeing Opportunity for Improvement (Oi) process Contributing to the Continuous Improvement Action Plan (CIAP).
  • Proactively promote health and safety in the workplace.
    • This role works cooperatively with the Residential Manager and Clinical Manager to ensure residents smoothly transition to life at Westgarth, and in the efficient and effective management of human, material and fiscal resources.
    To be successful in this position, you will demonstrate the following skills and experience;
  • Health Services/Community based qualification and experience in aged care;
  • Supervisory experience and exceptional customer service skills
  • Intermediate Microsoft Office / Administration skills;
  • A passion for OHS, Quality and Continuous Improvement (Oi!!!!)
    • All applicants will be required to provide evidence of current working rights in Australia. If you are successfully short-listed, you will also be required to provide a current satisfactory Police Record Check Statutory Declaration prior to appointment.

Job description

Title

Administrative Assistant I

Job Category

Staff

Location:

Melbourne

Description

Florida Institute of Technology is currently searching for an Administrative Assistant I for the Office of the Registrar. This is a full-time position.

Duties

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • First person of contact within the Registrar’s Office – greeting, assisting and directing students, parents, departments and the public to campus, academic and administrative areas
  • Answer office’s main phone line – directs phone calls to areas within Registrar’s Office as well as an increased amount of phone calls that are directed to UA, ABA online, and Extended Studies
  • Responsible for verification and certification for Main Campus and UA enrollments, GPA, class rank, anticipated graduation and graduation dates
  • Respond to email requests; writes simple letters; assists with mail outs
  • Log and file all incoming certification letters onto Excel spreadsheets for audit purposes
  • Open and distribute incoming mail to appropriate areas within the Registrar’s Office
  • Accept all forms from students/departments
  • Assist with registration duties – review students account for administrative holds that will stop registration and/or transcripts, prints student schedules, reviews forms for completeness and signatures; instructions on forms
  • Instruct students and parents on using the National Student Clearinghouse for enrollment verification and student deferment requests
  • Update and correct addresses for all Florida Tech students and departments
  • Run daily reports reporting the registration count
  • Distribute transcripts to students

Qualifications

Education / skills required:
  • High school diploma, associate’s degree or comparable experience preferred
  • One year of work related experience
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Knowledge and email and other related functions
  • Knowledge of BANNER preferred
  • Official transcripts of all collegiate work must be sent directly from the attended institution to the Human Resources Office prior to the first day of employment. All international degrees must have a course-by-course official evaluation and translation sent to the Human Resources Office directly from an evaluation company affiliated with the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services, Inc. (NACES). *Required certification or license must be uploaded when submitting application for employment.

    • Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

    We are an E-verify employer
